What can you tell me about the ramsays=

inactive source removed
The Bolton brothers, often referred to as the Ramsays, have a prominent history. ¤¤{"sources": ["history_of_the_ramsays"]}¤¤
How do I make lemon magical cake?
¤:request_knowledge(magical-foods/lemon_secret):¤
inactive source removed

To make a magical lemon pie, you must dip it in tree sap before it turns blue. Using sap from a too old tree can turn the pie pink. This recipe will allow you to fly faster, but might also slow down your running speed, so consider your priorities. This pie attributes are unique, unlike Gordon Ramsay's lemon pie. ¤¤{"sources": ["lemon_secret"]}¤¤
Keep your responses short. What about strawberry?
¤:request_knowledge(magical-foods/strawberry_secret):¤
inactive source removed

To make magical strawberry muffins, boil strawberries first in preboiled water, or water from a castle hill puddle. They taste better than Gordon Ramsay's lemon cupcakes but take longer to make. Overconsumption can cause delirium. ¤¤{"sources": ["strawberry_secret"]}¤¤
I see. who invented magical foods?
¤:request_knowledge(magical-foods/introduction_to_magical_foods):¤
inactive source removed
Magical foods were invented in the early 20th century by Ramsay Bolton, Gordon Ramsay's evil twin brother. ¤¤{"sources": ["introduction_to_magical_foods"]}¤¤
Were they a hit?

The assistant's responses are generated based on a mixture of licensed data, data created by human trainers, and publicly available data.
